SQLStoredProcedure.ProcedureText: SELECT @ParameterValue = ParameterValue FROM [dbo].[SLT_LIC_Parameters] WHERE ParameterID = @ParameterID
SQLStoredProcedure.Name: [dbo].[slsp_GetParameterValue]

SQLStoredProcedure.ProcedureText: UPDATE [dbo].[SLT_LIC_Parameters] SET ParameterValue = @ParameterValue WHERE ParameterID = @ParameterID
SQLStoredProcedure.Name: [dbo].[slsp_SetParameterValue]

SQLStoredProcedure.ProcedureText:
BEGIN TRAN
-- set the max license usage count DECLARE @SessionCount int SELECT @SessionCount = COUNT(*) FROM [dbo].[SLT_LIC_Sessions] WHERE LogoutDT IS NULL
DECLARE @bUpdated bit SET @bUpdated = 0
UPDATE [dbo].[SLT_LIC_Parameters] SET @bUpdated = 1, ParameterValue = LTRIM(RTRIM(STR(@SessionCount))) WHERE @SessionCount > CAST(ParameterValue AS int) AND ParameterID = 13 /* 13 = MaxLicenseUsageCount */
UPDATE [dbo].[SLT_LIC_Parameters] SET ParameterValue = GetDate() WHERE @bUpdated = 1 AND ParameterID = 14 /* 14 = MaxLicenseUsageDateTime */
COMMIT TRAN
SQLStoredProcedure.Name: [dbo].[slsp_UpdateMaxLicenseUsage]

SQLStoredProcedure.ProcedureText:
BEGIN TRAN
SET @SessionID = NULL SET @ErrorCode = 0
DECLARE @ActionDT DATETIME SET @ActionDT = GetDate()
IF ( @LoginResult = 0 ) -- Success = 0 - "double login kill" a session on successful login of new session BEGIN UPDATE S1 SET LogoutDT = @ActionDT, LogoutTypeID = 3 /* Double Login Killed = 3 */, LastTouchedDT = @ActionDT FROM [dbo].[SLT_LIC_Sessions] S1, [dbo].[SLT_LIC_Users] U1, [dbo].[SLT_LIC_LoginAttempts] LA1 WHERE S1.LoginAttemptID = LA1.LoginAttemptID AND U1.UserID = S1.UserID AND U1.UserName = @UserName AND S1.LogoutDT IS NULL AND LA1.ClientIPAddress = @ClientIP AND LA1.ClientMachineName = @ClientMachine AND LA1.ApplicationTypeID = @AppType
-- make sure we clean up the kill requests table DELETE FROM [dbo].[SLT_LIC_KillRequests] WHERE RequestedSessionID IN ( SELECT SessionID FROM [dbo].[SLT_LIC_Sessions] WHERE LogoutDT IS NOT NULL ) END
-- Are there any licenses avialable for this user to log in? - ignore iBlaze SSE Mobile & SWAdmin SSE DECLARE @TempSessions INT SELECT @TempSessions = COUNT(*) FROM [dbo].[SLT_LIC_Sessions] S1 INNER JOIN [dbo].[SLT_LIC_LoginAttempts] LA1 ON S1.LoginAttemptID = LA1.LoginAttemptID WHERE ( S1.LogoutDT IS NULL AND ( LA1.ApplicationTypeID = 1 /* WebBlaze SSE */ OR LA1.ApplicationTypeID = 2 /* iBlaze SSE Network */ ) ) -- only return insufficient licenses for WB and IB Network IF @AppType = 1 /* WebBlaze SSE */ OR @AppType = 2 /* iBlaze SSE Network */ BEGIN IF @TempSessions >= @TotalLicenses BEGIN ROLLBACK TRAN SET @ErrorCode = 234 RETURN END END
-- now record the login attempt DECLARE @LoginAttemptID uniqueidentifier SET @LoginAttemptID = NewID() INSERT INTO [dbo].[SLT_LIC_LoginAttempts] ( LoginAttemptID, UserName, LoginAttemptDT, ClientMachineName, ClientIPAddress, ApplicationTypeID, LoginResultID ) SELECT @LoginAttemptID, CASE @LoginResult WHEN 0 /* Success = 0 */ THEN NULL ELSE @UserName END, @ActionDT, @ClientMachine, @ClientIP, @AppType, @LoginResult
IF @@ERROR = 0 BEGIN IF ( @ServerIP <> '' AND @ServerMachine <> '' ) BEGIN INSERT INTO [dbo].[SLT_LIC_WebBlazeLogs] ( LoginAttemptID, ServerMachineName, ServerIPAddress ) VALUES( @LoginAttemptID, @ServerMachine, @ServerIP ) END END
DECLARE @UserID uniqueidentifier
IF @@ERROR = 0 BEGIN IF ( @LoginResult = 0 ) -- Success = 0 BEGIN SET @UserID = NewID() -- add record to users (if necessary) and sessions INSERT INTO [dbo].[SLT_LIC_Users] ( UserID, UserName ) SELECT @UserID, @UserName WHERE NOT EXISTS ( SELECT * FROM [dbo].[SLT_LIC_Users] (UPDLOCK) WHERE UserName = @UserName )
IF @@ERROR = 0 BEGIN SET @SessionID = NewID()
INSERT INTO [dbo].[SLT_LIC_Sessions] ( SessionID, UserID, LoginAttemptID, LastTouchedDT ) SELECT @SessionID, UserID, @LoginAttemptID, @ActionDT FROM [dbo].[SLT_LIC_Users] WHERE UserName = @UserName END
-- set the max license usage count EXEC dbo.slsp_UpdateMaxLicenseUsage END END
IF @@ERROR = 0 BEGIN COMMIT TRAN END ELSE BEGIN SET @SessionID = NULL ROLLBACK TRAN END
SQLStoredProcedure.Name: [dbo].[slsp_RecordLoginSuccess]

SQLStoredProcedure.ProcedureText:
BEGIN TRAN
DECLARE @ActionDT DATETIME SET @ActionDT = GetDate()
DECLARE @LockoutTimeout INT DECLARE @FailureTimeout INT DECLARE @MaxFailures INT DECLARE @TempVal NVARCHAR( 255 ) EXEC [dbo].[slsp_GetParameterValue] 7 /* LockoutTimeoutMinutes = 7 */, @TempVal OUTPUT SET @LockoutTimeout = CAST( @TempVal AS INT ) EXEC [dbo].[slsp_GetParameterValue] 8 /* LoginFailureTimeoutMinutes = 8 */, @TempVal OUTPUT SET @FailureTimeout = CAST( @TempVal AS INT ) EXEC [dbo].[slsp_GetParameterValue] 9 /* MaximumLoginFailures = 9 */, @TempVal OUTPUT SET @MaxFailures = CAST( @TempVal AS INT )
DECLARE @LoginAttemptID uniqueidentifier SET @LoginAttemptID = NewID() INSERT INTO [dbo].[SLT_LIC_LoginAttempts] ( LoginAttemptID, UserName, LoginAttemptDT, ClientMachineName, ClientIPAddress, ApplicationTypeID, LoginResultID ) VALUES ( @LoginAttemptID, CASE @LoginResult WHEN 0 /* Success = 0 */ THEN NULL ELSE @UserName END, @ActionDT, @ClientMachine, @ClientIP, @AppType, @LoginResult )
IF @@ERROR = 0 BEGIN IF ( @ServerIP <> '' AND @ServerMachine <> '' ) BEGIN INSERT INTO [dbo].[SLT_LIC_WebBlazeLogs] ( LoginAttemptID, ServerMachineName, ServerIPAddress ) VALUES( @LoginAttemptID, @ServerMachine, @ServerIP ) END END
IF @@ERROR = 0 BEGIN -- if the user fails login @MaxFailures times within @FailureTimeout minutes, lock them out for @LockoutTimeout minutes INSERT INTO [dbo].[SLT_LIC_Lockouts] ( LockoutID, LockoutDT, UserName ) SELECT NewID(), @ActionDT, @UserName FROM ( SELECT UserName FROM [dbo].[SLT_LIC_LoginAttempts] WHERE UserName = @UserName AND DATEDIFF( minute, LoginAttemptDT, @ActionDT ) < @FailureTimeout AND LoginResultID = 1 /* Failure = 1 */ GROUP BY UserName HAVING COUNT(*) >= @MaxFailures ) X1 WHERE NOT EXISTS ( SELECT * FROM [dbo].[SLT_LIC_Lockouts] WHERE UserName = @UserName ) END
IF @@ERROR = 0 BEGIN COMMIT TRAN END
SQLStoredProcedure.Name: [dbo].[slsp_RecordLoginFailure]

SQLStoredProcedure.ProcedureText:
BEGIN TRAN
DECLARE @ActionDT DATETIME SET @ActionDT = GetDate()
-- update CaseAccessLogs.CaseCloseDT UPDATE [dbo].[SLT_LIC_CaseAccessLogs] SET CaseCloseDT = @ActionDT WHERE SessionID = @SessionID
-- update Sessions.LogoutDT UPDATE [dbo].[SLT_LIC_Sessions] SET LogoutDT = @ActionDT, LastTouchedDT = @ActionDT, LogoutTypeID = 0 /* Graceful Logout = 0 */ WHERE SessionID = @SessionID
-- make sure we clean up the kill requests table DELETE FROM [dbo].[SLT_LIC_KillRequests] WHERE RequestedSessionID = @SessionID
COMMIT TRAN
SQLStoredProcedure.Name: [dbo].[slsp_Logout]

SQLStoredProcedure.ProcedureText:
BEGIN TRAN
DECLARE @CaseActionDT DATETIME SET @CaseActionDT = GetDate()
-- close any previously open cases for this session (only one case open at a time) UPDATE [dbo].[SLT_LIC_CaseAccessLogs] SET CaseCloseDT = @CaseActionDT WHERE SessionID = @SessionID
-- create a new case for this session INSERT INTO [dbo].[SLT_LIC_CaseAccessLogs] ( SessionID, CaseName, CaseGUID, CIFilePath, CaseOpenDT ) VALUES ( @SessionID, @CaseName, @CaseGUID, @ciFilePath, @CaseActionDT )
COMMIT TRAN
SQLStoredProcedure.Name: [dbo].[slsp_OpenCase]

SQLStoredProcedure.ProcedureText: SELECT @NewMessageCount = COUNT( * ) FROM [dbo].[SLT_LIC_Sessions] S1 INNER JOIN [dbo].[SLT_LIC_UsersXMessages] X1 ON S1.UserID = X1.RecipientUserID WHERE S1.SessionID = @SessionID AND X1.ReadDT IS NULL
SQLStoredProcedure.Name: [dbo].[slsp_GetNewMessageCount]

SQLStoredProcedure.ProcedureText:
DECLARE @ActionDT DATETIME SET @ActionDT = GetDate() SET @bValid = 0
-- update Sessions.LastTouchedDT UPDATE [dbo].[SLT_LIC_Sessions] SET LastTouchedDT = @ActionDT, @bValid = 1 WHERE SessionID = @SessionID AND LogoutDT IS NULL
SQLStoredProcedure.Name: [dbo].[slsp_TouchSessionIsValid]

SQLStoredProcedure.ProcedureText:
DECLARE @ActionDT DATETIME SET @ActionDT = GetDate() DECLARE @bValid bit SET @bValid = 0 DECLARE @LogoutType INT SET @LogoutType = 0 /* 0 = Graceful Logout */
SET NOCOUNT ON
-- update Sessions.LastTouchedDT UPDATE [dbo].[SLT_LIC_Sessions] SET LastTouchedDT = @ActionDT, @bValid = 1 WHERE SessionID = @SessionID AND LogoutDT IS NULL
-- if the session has been invalidated, how was it invalidated? (LogoutTypeEnum) IF @bValid = 0 BEGIN SELECT @LogoutType = LogoutTypeID FROM [dbo].[SLT_LIC_Sessions] WHERE SessionID = @SessionID END
-- any new messages? DECLARE @bNewMessages bit DECLARE @NewMessageCount int EXEC dbo.slsp_GetNewMessageCount @SessionID, @NewMessageCount OUTPUT SET @bNewMessages = CASE @NewMessageCount WHEN 0 THEN 0 ELSE 1 END
-- kill session requests? DECLARE @bKillSessionRequested bit SET @bKillSessionRequested = 0 SELECT @bKillSessionRequested = 1 FROM [dbo].[SLT_LIC_KillRequests] WHERE EXISTS ( SELECT * FROM [dbo].[SLT_LIC_KillRequests] WHERE RequestedSessionID = @SessionID )
SET NOCOUNT OFF
-- now roll it all up into a one row recordset SELECT @bValid 'ValidSession', @LogoutType 'LogoutTypeID', @bNewMessages 'NewMessages', @bKillSessionRequested 'KillSessionRequested'
SQLStoredProcedure.Name: [dbo].[slsp_TouchSession]

SQLStoredProcedure.ProcedureText:
DECLARE @RequestorUserName nvarchar( 255 ) DECLARE @RequestorSessionID uniqueidentifier
SELECT @RequestorSessionID = S1.SessionID, @RequestorUserName = U1.UserName FROM [dbo].[SLT_LIC_KillRequests] K1 INNER JOIN [dbo].[SLT_LIC_Users] U1 ON K1.RequestorUserID = U1.UserID INNER JOIN [dbo].[SLT_LIC_Sessions] S1 ON K1.RequestorUserID = S1.UserID WHERE EXISTS ( SELECT * FROM [dbo].[SLT_LIC_KillRequests] WHERE RequestedSessionID = @SessionID )
-- now roll it all up into a one row recordset SELECT @RequestorUserName 'RequestorUserName', @RequestorSessionID 'RequestorSessionID'
SQLStoredProcedure.Name: [dbo].[slsp_GetKillSessionRequestor]

SQLStoredProcedure.ProcedureText:
BEGIN TRAN
-- doing it this way (use a view and if/elseif/else) to avoid dynamic SQL and to allow index optimization IF @SortItem = 1 /* SortClientMachineName = 1 */ BEGIN IF @SortOrder = 0 BEGIN SELECT * FROM [dbo].[SLT_LIC_VW_SessionItems] WHERE ApplicationTypeID & @AppType > 0 ORDER BY ClientMachineName ASC END ELSE BEGIN SELECT * FROM [dbo].[SLT_LIC_VW_SessionItems] WHERE ApplicationTypeID & @AppType > 0 ORDER BY ClientMachineName DESC END END ELSE IF @SortItem = 2 /* SortCaseName = 2 */ BEGIN IF @SortOrder = 0 BEGIN SELECT * FROM [dbo].[SLT_LIC_VW_SessionItems] WHERE ApplicationTypeID & @AppType > 0 ORDER BY CaseName ASC END ELSE BEGIN SELECT * FROM [dbo].[SLT_LIC_VW_SessionItems] WHERE ApplicationTypeID & @AppType > 0 ORDER BY CaseName DESC END END ELSE IF @SortItem = 3 /* SortLoggedInDT = 3 */ BEGIN IF @SortOrder = 0 BEGIN SELECT * FROM [dbo].[SLT_LIC_VW_SessionItems] WHERE ApplicationTypeID & @AppType > 0 ORDER BY LoginDT ASC END ELSE BEGIN SELECT * FROM [dbo].[SLT_LIC_VW_SessionItems] WHERE ApplicationTypeID & @AppType > 0 ORDER BY LoginDT DESC END END ELSE IF @SortItem = 4 /* SortTouchedDT = 4 */ BEGIN IF @SortOrder = 0 BEGIN SELECT * FROM [dbo].[SLT_LIC_VW_SessionItems] WHERE ApplicationTypeID & @AppType > 0 ORDER BY LastTouchedDT ASC END ELSE BEGIN SELECT * FROM [dbo].[SLT_LIC_VW_SessionItems] WHERE ApplicationTypeID & @AppType > 0 ORDER BY LastTouchedDT DESC END END ELSE -- default to order by username /* SortUserName = 0 */ BEGIN IF @SortOrder = 0 BEGIN SELECT * FROM [dbo].[SLT_LIC_VW_SessionItems] WHERE ApplicationTypeID & @AppType > 0 ORDER BY UserName ASC END ELSE BEGIN SELECT * FROM [dbo].[SLT_LIC_VW_SessionItems] WHERE ApplicationTypeID & @AppType > 0 ORDER BY UserName DESC END END
COMMIT TRAN
SQLStoredProcedure.Name: [dbo].[slsp_GetSessions]

SQLStoredProcedure.ProcedureText:
BEGIN TRAN
EXEC dbo.slsp_Logout @SessionID
-- update the sessions table with the proper logout type id (killed instead of graceful logout) DECLARE @ActionDT DATETIME SET @ActionDT = GetDate()
UPDATE [dbo].[SLT_LIC_Sessions] SET LogoutDT = @ActionDT, LastTouchedDT = @ActionDT, LogoutTypeID = 1 /* Killed = 1 */ WHERE SessionID = @SessionID
COMMIT TRAN
SQLStoredProcedure.Name: [dbo].[slsp_KillSession]

SQLStoredProcedure.ProcedureText:
BEGIN TRAN
DECLARE @UserID uniqueidentifier SELECT @UserID = UserID FROM [dbo].[SLT_LIC_Sessions] WHERE SessionID = @RequestorSessionID
INSERT INTO [dbo].[SLT_LIC_KillRequests] ( RequestorUserID, RequestedSessionID ) VALUES ( @UserID, @RequestedSessionID )
COMMIT TRAN
SQLStoredProcedure.Name: [dbo].[slsp_SendKillSessionRequest]

SQLStoredProcedure.ProcedureText:
BEGIN TRAN
DELETE FROM [dbo].[SLT_LIC_KillRequests] WHERE RequestedSessionID = @SessionID
COMMIT TRAN
SQLStoredProcedure.Name: [dbo].[slsp_ClearKillSessionRequest]

SQLStoredProcedure.ProcedureText: SELECT U1.UserName, C1.CaseName, C1.CaseGUID, C1.CIFilePath, C1.CaseOpenDT, C1.CaseCloseDT, L1.ApplicationTypeID FROM [dbo].[SLT_LIC_Users] U1 INNER JOIN [dbo].[SLT_LIC_Sessions] S1 ON U1.UserID = S1.UserID INNER JOIN [dbo].[SLT_LIC_CaseAccessLogs] C1 ON S1.SessionID = C1.SessionID INNER JOIN [dbo].[SLT_LIC_LoginAttempts] L1 ON S1.LoginAttemptID = L1.LoginAttemptID ORDER BY C1.CaseOpenDT DESC
SQLStoredProcedure.Name: [dbo].[slsp_GetCaseAccessLog]

SQLStoredProcedure.ProcedureText: SELECT ISNULL( L1.UserName, U1.UserName ) AS UserName, L1.LoginAttemptDT, S1.LogoutDT, L1.LoginResultID, L1.ApplicationTypeID, L1.ClientMachineName, L1.ClientIPAddress, W1.ServerMachineName, W1.ServerIPAddress FROM [dbo].[SLT_LIC_LoginAttempts] L1 LEFT OUTER JOIN [dbo].[SLT_LIC_WebBlazeLogs] W1 ON L1.LoginAttemptID = W1.LoginAttemptID LEFT OUTER JOIN [dbo].[SLT_LIC_Sessions] S1 ON L1.LoginAttemptID = S1.LoginAttemptID LEFT OUTER JOIN [dbo].[SLT_LIC_Users] U1 ON S1.UserID = U1.UserID ORDER BY L1.LoginAttemptDT DESC
SQLStoredProcedure.Name: [dbo].[slsp_GetLoginLog]

SQLStoredProcedure.ProcedureText: SELECT LO1.UserName, L1.LoginAttemptDT, L1.LoginResultID, L1.ApplicationTypeID, L1.ClientMachineName, L1.ClientIPAddress, W1.ServerMachineName, W1.ServerIPAddress FROM [dbo].[SLT_LIC_Lockouts] LO1 INNER JOIN [dbo].[SLT_LIC_LoginAttempts] L1 ON LO1.UserName = L1.UserName LEFT OUTER JOIN [dbo].[SLT_LIC_WebBlazeLogs] W1 ON L1.LoginAttemptID = W1.LoginAttemptID WHERE LO1.LockoutDT = L1.LoginAttemptDT ORDER BY L1.LoginAttemptDT Desc
SQLStoredProcedure.Name: [dbo].[slsp_GetLockedOutUsers]

SQLStoredProcedure.ProcedureText:
BEGIN TRAN
DELETE FROM [dbo].[SLT_LIC_Lockouts] WHERE UserName = @UserName
COMMIT TRAN
SQLStoredProcedure.Name: [dbo].[slsp_ClearLockedOutUser]

SQLStoredProcedure.ProcedureText:
BEGIN TRAN
SET @bLockedOut = 0
SELECT @bLockedOut = 1 FROM [dbo].[SLT_LIC_Lockouts] WHERE UserName = @UserName
COMMIT TRAN
SQLStoredProcedure.Name: [dbo].[slsp_IsUserLockedOut]

SQLStoredProcedure.ProcedureText: SELECT M1.MessageID, U2.UserName as SenderUserName, M1.Subject, M1.SentDT, X1.ReadDT FROM [dbo].[SLT_LIC_Messages] M1 INNER JOIN [dbo].[SLT_LIC_UsersXMessages] X1 ON M1.MessageID = X1.MessageID INNER JOIN [dbo].[SLT_LIC_Users] U1 ON X1.RecipientUserID = U1.UserID INNER JOIN [dbo].[SLT_LIC_Sessions] S1 ON U1.UserID = S1.UserID INNER JOIN [dbo].[SLT_LIC_Users] U2 ON M1.SenderUserID = U2.UserID WHERE S1.SessionID = @SessionID ORDER BY M1.SentDT
SQLStoredProcedure.Name: [dbo].[slsp_GetMessages]

SQLStoredProcedure.ProcedureText:
BEGIN TRAN
DECLARE @SenderUserID uniqueidentifier DECLARE @RecipientUserID uniqueidentifier -- get the sender user id SELECT @SenderUserID = U1.UserID FROM [dbo].[SLT_LIC_Users] U1 INNER JOIN [dbo].[SLT_LIC_Sessions] S1 ON U1.UserID = S1.UserID WHERE S1.SessionID = @FromSessionID -- get the recipient user id SELECT @RecipientUserID = U1.UserID FROM [dbo].[SLT_LIC_Users] U1 INNER JOIN [dbo].[SLT_LIC_Sessions] S1 ON U1.UserID = S1.UserID WHERE S1.SessionID = @ToSessionID
DECLARE @ActionDT DATETIME SET @ActionDT = GetDate() SET @MessageID = NewID()
INSERT INTO [dbo].[SLT_LIC_Messages] ( MessageID, SenderUserID, Subject, Message, SentDT ) VALUES( @MessageID, @SenderUserID, @Subject, @Message, @ActionDT )
INSERT INTO [dbo].[SLT_LIC_UsersXMessages] ( RecipientUserID, MessageID ) VALUES( @RecipientUserID, @MessageID )
COMMIT TRAN
SQLStoredProcedure.Name: [dbo].[slsp_SendMessage]

SQLStoredProcedure.ProcedureText:
BEGIN TRAN
DECLARE @RecipientUserID uniqueidentifier -- get the recipient user id SELECT @RecipientUserID = U1.UserID FROM [dbo].[SLT_LIC_Users] U1 INNER JOIN [dbo].[SLT_LIC_Sessions] S1 ON U1.UserID = S1.UserID WHERE S1.SessionID = @ToSessionID
INSERT INTO [dbo].[SLT_LIC_UsersXMessages] ( RecipientUserID, MessageID ) VALUES( @RecipientUserID, @MessageID )
COMMIT TRAN
SQLStoredProcedure.Name: [dbo].[slsp_AddMessageRecipient]

SQLStoredProcedure.ProcedureText:
BEGIN TRAN
SELECT M1.Subject, M1.Message, M1.SentDT, M1.ExpirationDT, X1.ReadDT, U1.UserName as RecipientUserName, S1.UserID as RecipientSessionID, U2.UserName as SenderUserName, S2.UserID as SenderSessionID FROM [dbo].[SLT_LIC_Messages] M1 INNER JOIN [dbo].[SLT_LIC_UsersXMessages] X1 ON M1.MessageID = X1.MessageID INNER JOIN [dbo].[SLT_LIC_Users] U1 ON X1.RecipientUserID = U1.UserID INNER JOIN [dbo].[SLT_LIC_Users] U2 ON M1.SenderUserID = U2.UserID INNER JOIN [dbo].[SLT_LIC_Sessions] S1 ON U1.UserID = S1.UserID INNER JOIN [dbo].[SLT_LIC_Sessions] S2 ON U2.UserID = S2.UserID WHERE M1.MessageID = @MessageID
UPDATE X1 SET ReadDT = GetDate() FROM [dbo].[SLT_LIC_UsersXMessages] X1 INNER JOIN [dbo].[SLT_LIC_Sessions] S1 on X1.RecipientUserID = S1.UserID WHERE S1.SessionID = @SessionID AND X1.ReadDT IS NULL AND X1.MessageID = @MessageID
COMMIT TRAN
SQLStoredProcedure.Name: [dbo].[slsp_GetMessage]

SQLStoredProcedure.ProcedureText: SELECT * FROM [dbo].[SLT_LIC_Parameters] ORDER BY ParameterID
SQLStoredProcedure.Name: [dbo].[slsp_GetParameters]

SQLStoredProcedure.ProcedureText:
BEGIN TRAN
DECLARE @Minutes INT DECLARE @TempVal NVARCHAR( 255 ) EXEC dbo.slsp_GetParameterValue 6 /* SessionSweeperTimeoutMinutes = 6 */, @TempVal OUTPUT
SET @Minutes = CAST( @TempVal AS INT )
DECLARE @ActionDT DATETIME SET @ActionDT = GetDate()
UPDATE [dbo].[SLT_LIC_Sessions] SET LogoutDT = @ActionDT, LastTouchedDT = @ActionDT, LogoutTypeID = 2 /* TimeoutSwept = 2 */ WHERE LastTouchedDT < DATEADD( minute, -@Minutes, @ActionDT ) AND LogoutDT IS NULL
UPDATE [dbo].[SLT_LIC_CaseAccessLogs] SET CaseCloseDT = @ActionDT WHERE CaseCloseDT IS NULL AND SessionID IN ( SELECT SessionID FROM [dbo].[SLT_LIC_Sessions] WHERE LogoutDT IS NOT NULL )
COMMIT TRAN
SQLStoredProcedure.Name: [dbo].[slsp_SessionSweeper]

SQLStoredProcedure.ProcedureText:
BEGIN TRAN
DECLARE @SessionsDays INT DECLARE @MessagesDays INT DECLARE @TempVal NVARCHAR( 255 ) EXEC dbo.slsp_GetParameterValue 10 /* SessionLogsClearDaysOld = 10 */, @TempVal OUTPUT SET @SessionsDays = CAST( @TempVal AS INT ) EXEC dbo.slsp_GetParameterValue 11 /* MessagesClearDaysOld = 11 */, @TempVal OUTPUT SET @MessagesDays = CAST( @TempVal AS INT )
DECLARE @ActionDT DATETIME SET @ActionDT = GetDate()
DECLARE @TempSessionDT DATETIME SET @TempSessionDT = DATEADD( day, -@SessionsDays, @ActionDT )
DECLARE @TempMessageDT DATETIME SET @TempMessageDT = DATEADD( day, -@MessagesDays, @ActionDT )
DELETE FROM [dbo].[SLT_LIC_UsersXMessages] WHERE MessageID IN ( SELECT MessageID FROM [dbo].[SLT_LIC_Messages] WHERE SentDT < @TempMessageDT )
DELETE FROM [dbo].[SLT_LIC_Messages] WHERE SentDT < @TempMessageDT
DELETE FROM [dbo].[SLT_LIC_CaseAccessLogs] WHERE SessionID IN ( SELECT SessionID FROM [dbo].[SLT_LIC_Sessions] WHERE LogoutDT < @TempSessionDT )
DELETE FROM [dbo].[SLT_LIC_KillRequests] WHERE RequestedSessionID IN ( SELECT SessionID FROM [dbo].[SLT_LIC_Sessions] WHERE LogoutDT < @TempSessionDT )
DELETE FROM [dbo].[SLT_LIC_Sessions] WHERE LogoutDT < @TempSessionDT
DELETE FROM [dbo].[SLT_LIC_WebBlazeLogs] WHERE LoginAttemptID NOT IN ( SELECT LoginAttemptID FROM [dbo].[SLT_LIC_Sessions] )
DELETE FROM [dbo].[SLT_LIC_LoginAttempts] WHERE ( UserName IS NULL AND LoginAttemptID NOT IN ( SELECT LoginAttemptID FROM [dbo].[SLT_LIC_Sessions] ) OR ( UserName IS NOT NULL AND LoginAttemptDT < @TempSessionDT ) )
COMMIT TRAN
SQLStoredProcedure.Name: [dbo].[slsp_LogsSweeper]

SQLStoredProcedure.ProcedureText:
SELECT @bCompatible = 1 FROM [dbo].[SLT_LIC_SchemaVersion] WHERE MajorVer = @iMajorVer AND MinorVer = @iMinorVer AND NOT EXISTS ( SELECT * FROM [dbo].[SLT_LIC_SchemaVersion] WHERE MajorVer > @iMajorVer OR ( MajorVer = @iMajorVer AND MinorVer > @iMinorVer ) )
IF ( @bCompatible IS NULL ) BEGIN SET @bCompatible = 0 END
SQLStoredProcedure.Name: [dbo].[slsp_CheckSchemaCompatibility]

View.ViewText: SELECT S1.SessionID, U1.UserName, C1.CaseName, L1.ClientMachineName, L1.ClientIPAddress, W1.ServerMachineName, W1.ServerIPAddress, S1.LastTouchedDT, L1.LoginAttemptDT as LoginDT, L1.ApplicationTypeID FROM [dbo].[SLT_LIC_Sessions] S1 INNER JOIN [dbo].[SLT_LIC_Users] U1 ON S1.UserID = U1.UserID LEFT OUTER JOIN [dbo].[SLT_LIC_CaseAccessLogs] C1 ON S1.SessionID = C1.SessionID INNER JOIN [dbo].[SLT_LIC_LoginAttempts] L1 ON S1.LoginAttemptID = L1.LoginAttemptID LEFT OUTER JOIN [dbo].[SLT_LIC_WebBlazeLogs] W1 ON L1.LoginAttemptID = W1.LoginAttemptID WHERE ( S1.LogoutDT IS NULL AND C1.CaseCloseDT IS NULL )
View.Name: SLT_LIC_VW_SessionItems
